website_summaries.verdict: The Motorola Moto X Pure Edition is in the same class of unlocked, affordable flagship phones as the OnePlus 2, with one huge advantage: You can actually buy it.
pros: Mostly stock Android with little bloatware

customer_reviews.title: both bought on Amazon and both were seemingly great deals at the time of purchase
customer_reviews.text: I have both the 64gb n 32gb unlocked version, both bought on Amazon and both were seemingly great deals at the time of purchase........My advice is don't buy them, they heat up pretty seriously after 10 mins of YouTube playback since day 1, n after few months of usage wifi started to disconnect itself under such heat. Camera is good but basically no manual setting is allowed (even in 3rd party apps), night time video shooting is a joke, most footage is unusable. I caN get much better phones @ this price point today.
customer_reviews.author: KS

customer_reviews.title: I like
customer_reviews.text: I like this phone. It is the only smart phone I have ever had so don't know how it compares to others. The price was good, screen is bright and large. Nice that you can expand memory yourself. Being unlocked you can upgrade Android anytime you want. No useless bloatware from service vendors. Can go month to month on service. Can switch to a new carrier very easy even if they use different network technology (ATT vs Verizon). The only weak areas are battery life (charges fast though), camera is average, touch screen is not sensitive enough sometimes. All in all a great phone for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Tory Bennetsen

customer_reviews.title: A+ Phone
customer_reviews.text: Great phone, Everything I've wanted from an Android phone for the last 4 years. Screen is a little bigger than I would like but this is mitigated by having an almost nonexistent bezel. Battery life is decent, but if you have a day of heavy use the Turbocharger makes up for it. It manages to continually impress me every day.
customer_reviews.author: Mikey 'Killer'

customer_reviews.title: Bought it Three Times
customer_reviews.text: This phone was a favorite of mine because of its affordable price, crisp, clear screen and the fact that it came with no bloatware. I bought it three times because I just didn't want to switch or spend hours online comparing other phones looking for the same features. It gets warm to the touch after prolonged use, but this is not a major problem. I considered buying it again as a backup phone to the Samsung s9 but decided on the G7 Power because of the longer battery life and larger screen it touts. We'll see how that goes...
customer_reviews.author: Shrewd Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Camera is good, love the ambient motion display
customer_reviews.text: I got this phone about 2-3 month after it was out for a steal on Amazon for a deal of the day. I have had absolutely no issues with it, got use to the size of the phone as I was coming from a 4.8". Camera is good, love the ambient motion display, motions for camera and flashlight, ect. Battery life is good and charges pretty Dame quickly as well. I definitely would recommend this product and infact did to my best friend which he also recently got it and he loves it as well. You can beat the specs at the price we received this phone at.
customer_reviews.author: Gary J.

customer_reviews.title: Better than my Samsungs
customer_reviews.text: Moto X Pure is by far the best cell phone I have owned. Previously had Carrier branded Samsung devices complete with all the unwanted bloat. This is the first phone that I have liked straight out of the box. Minimal pre installed Moto and Google apps. Twice the battery life of my S5 Active and camera will amaze you. Lots of custom development for this device will ensure long life even after Motorola stops OTA support.
customer_reviews.author: Jfalls

customer_reviews.title: Amazing phone, unbelievable price.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my aging S5 that would no longer charge.(The charger port was worn out) I was very pleased with the phone and used it until I had to change devices for work. I now have an S7 and still miss this phone. The screen is amazing, the wooden back is unique, it is extremely fast and the Turbo charging feature should be standard on all phones. I truely charged my phone while getting ready in the morning and that was it. 30 or so minutes for 23 hours of power with mild to moderate use. I passed the phone on to a family member who is now loving the phone just as I did.
customer_reviews.author: paboothz71

customer_reviews.title: Battery lasted only for about 10 months of normal use.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this phone back in February 2016. Lasted about 10 months before a full battery would only last an hour or two max before dieing. I really loved it when the battery worked well. Only two stars for this phone, as for the price of it, the battery should have been good enough to last more than a year.
customer_reviews.author: T McGee

customer_reviews.title: and one of my favorite things about this phone is that the ones I ...
customer_reviews.text: This phone was my first unlocked phone - I followed the directions that other folks have posted regarding activation on Verizon's network (bought a new Micro SIM Card, activated online) and was up and running very quickly. I did notice that many of the apps that carried over from my previous phone (HTC One M7) were unneeded on my MxPE, and one of my favorite things about this phone is that the ones I didn't want were easily uninstalled. When Verizon (like pretty much all the carriers) stopped subsidizing the cost of the phones, I was a little worried about spending money outright for a phone - but this one has been excellent thus far!
customer_reviews.author: J. Such

customer_reviews.title: This cell phone is very bad quality, I don't use the phone for long ...
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy it !!! This cell phone is very bad quality, I don't use the phone for long time, this product doesn't work, I tried to fix it in the mobile phone store, but they said that it would be very expensive to fix it , so I want to return it , they only refund to me a part of money, I will never buy anything from this seller again, I don't like it .
customer_reviews.author: Kellyyang

customer_reviews.title: I love this phone and the ample storage space
customer_reviews.text: I love this Moto X Pure. I switched from a 2014 Samsung Galaxy S5, which I originally loved, but I was constantly running out of storage space. Samsung lost my business by selling only a 16GB version of the GS5 in the United States and loading it up with bloatware. It was incredibly frustrating to be unable to delete apps I didn't want. I'm happy Motorola keeps pre-loaded apps to a minimum. The sound on the Moto X Pure is so much better, I'm amazed. Videos are beautiful, and it's nice to have a somewhat larger screen. With 64GB plus the microSD option, I don't expect to ever run out of space again.
customer_reviews.author: Kristine E

customer_reviews.title: This is the best phone I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: This is the best phone I have ever owned, tons of features and the none of the manufacturer bloat ware that you usually have to spend days to extract. Extremely fast, fantastic display, excellent battery life. The only down side is storing music on the SD card without utilizing the SD card for additional hard space needed by the phone. I have been using this phone for the last year and I have had very few issues. I recommend adding a case immediately. If it falls and lands on one of the corners it will shatter and become worthless. Then you wouldn't have to buy a second one like me.
customer_reviews.author: TCHelper

customer_reviews.title: Get this one and not the Moto G!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a good value phone, neither cheap nor too expensive. I was between the Moto G4 and this one. I concluded it is much better to pay a bit more for the extras of the Moto X. I have not had any problems so far. It charges super fast. Turbo charger is included! No excessive heat problems as some have mentioned. The Android version comes free of bloatware, or so it seems. The camera is very very good for the price of this phone. Overall, I think this is one of the best value phones for your money! I bought this willingly and did NOT receive any compensation or gift for this review, seriously!
customer_reviews.author: Juan D.

customer_reviews.title: Unlocked, Good-looking, Stock-Android (almost)
customer_reviews.text: For nearly a 1/3rd the price of a Note 7, this phone is awesome. It is fast, screen is beautiful, especially with the color mode set to Vibrant. GPS works fast, when navigating and when playing Pokemon Go. It comes with nearly stock Android, and I have downloaded Marshmallow. The customizable back (when you order) is sweet. I got it with white and bamboo. I've only had it for a few days, but so far, I've been using it as much as and enjoying it as much as my now-damaged Note 4. And going unlocked, saves me money every month by being able to use a much cheaper plan than what I was paying every month.
customer_reviews.author: Anil Raghavan

customer_reviews.title: I thought I would really enjoy having the fingerprint scanner on the 6P
customer_reviews.text: I was really stuck between the Nexus 6P and the Moto X Pure Edition (MXPE). I ended up order the MXPE and have not regretted it at all. I thought I would really enjoy having the fingerprint scanner on the 6P, but having expandable memory is a much better tradeoff. The Moto X has a smartlock feature which really makes the finger print scanner unmissed, as you can add a location or bluetooth connections as "known" places to not lock the device. I have a MXPE for both my wife and myself and we are both happy with our switch from Samsung to Motorola. The MXPE is hard to beat on performance, price and features.
customer_reviews.author: eth555

customer_reviews.title: Nice features, marginal battery life
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent android phone. I haven't had any issues. I find the battery life after 3 months declining, but the 7 months after that hasn't gotten worse but I can't get through 12 hours without charging with medium use which is disappointing. I'd do your research on what is currently out there. I've been overall satisfied with phone features and have no regrets purchasing. This phone doesn't have a replaceable battery you can pop in and out.
customer_reviews.author: Family Man

customer_reviews.title: This is exactly what I wanted a fast large screen ...
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I wanted a fast large screen phone (but not bulky )without a bunch of clutter by my carrier (ATT) 16 gb is plenty for me since I can add a 128 gb micro sd. Worked flawless right out of the box Motorola migrate worked as well. And at $399 hard to beat. Still learning all it can do but I have been impressed so far.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond M

customer_reviews.title: Motorola Has Won Me Back
customer_reviews.text: I got sick of paying $500+ for phones. This phone offered a great alternative to the overpriced Samsung and Apple phones. Looks, feels and runs great. Not since the old days of the Motorola Razor have I like a Moto Phone. This Phone has won me back.
customer_reviews.author: N Moore

customer_reviews.title: Hands down, the best Android I have ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: Best Android phone I have owned to date. Very smooth, fast and the speakers sound good, but not quite the sound quality of the HTC One (M7, M8, or M9), but close enough to make me not miss mine. The speaker volume is about 50-75% louder and I actually find myself turning down my phone when listening to music or watching a video through the speakers. The included turbo charger is a great bonus for when you need to get a quick charge. If you're getting ready to leave for the night and your phone is at 50 or 60%, plug it in while you get ready and in 30 minutes it will be at 100%.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Randolph

customer_reviews.title: could have been good
customer_reviews.text: nice looking phone but i got a defective unit and its been nothing but problems for the last 2 years and i have to live with it because i dont know who to contact to get a replacement. I constantly get blue lines on the screen and sometimes the phone goes from 70% battery to 0 and shuts off as soon as i plug charger in it jumps to 50% smh
customer_reviews.author: mario

customer_reviews.title: Screen went crazy after just one month of purchasing it ...
customer_reviews.text: Screen went crazy after just one month of purchasing it! I no longer be able to return to Amazon! It gets frozen, app icons not responding, return button not responding, and screen won't go sleep which drains my battery fast! Surprised to be a moto phone! Update 8/24/2016: To be fair, out of nowhere screen returns to function normally, I don't know what has happened? was it because of some app I am using? Will such a problem happen again? I am happy now and I hope to enjoy using my moto phone as along as I could!
customer_reviews.author: kuko

customer_reviews.title: One ringy dingy  :)
customer_reviews.text: I am a fairly recent convert to smartphones (what can I say, I'm old). I bought this phone to replace my first-gen Moto G which just completely conked out on me. It was time for a newer phone anyway. :) The phone is a little larger than I'm used to, but that means the screen is easier to read. And of course, being the Pure edition, I didn't have to de-junkify it before I could use it. Updates and installations have gone very smoothly. I don't think I'll be looking to replace this any time soon. :)
customer_reviews.author: Marte

customer_reviews.title: Great, pure Google experience smartphone
customer_reviews.text: The unlocked bootloader is a great bonus, and there are a couple good ROMs available, but this phone would still be great, if kept totally stock, on Marshmallow! Battery life is good and the feel and handling are great, especially for a larger smartphone. I don't have large hands, burnt can still easily hold onto and use this phone, even with a case in it, even one handed. The turbo charging is awesome, abut you don't always have to use it, especially if you're concerned about harming the battery, with constant fast charging. My old Samsung, regular wall charger charges this phone in above average time, without turbo power, which is great for over night charging.
customer_reviews.author: P&K S

customer_reviews.title: I might keep it for a while
customer_reviews.text: This had the potential to be the last smartphone I bought for a while, but alas, it won't. Let me begin by saying how much I love the sturdiness of the phone. I feels pretty heavy compared to other smartphones. My problems come in the form of a previous user. You see, I bought mine used and after only a few weeks of use, it started showing signs of abuse. The screen cuts in and out sometimes, freezes, and turns all kinds of weird colors that the phone isn't suppose to show. Overall, the phone is easy to use and once I get the LCD fixed, I think I will enjoy it a lot more.
customer_reviews.author: Bear

customer_reviews.title: love the phone/brick
customer_reviews.text: love the phone....beautiful in every way a device can be....arrived 2 days quicker than said...just wish amazon would sell with the damn nano sim of our choice....not near a major metro town so coming up with a proper nano sim is proving to be quite difficult....great sale though....thanks Update: 3/1/16. Do not get this phone if u have a Verizon pre-pay account....u cannot transfer service to this phone....I'm being forced to get a contract....was pointless getting an unlocked phone...just wanted to use prepay on a better phone than some Verizon /Walmart crap....well..guess I'll go to straight talk byop..see if that works....was sooo not the plan....Amazon needs to put that little fact about the prepay issue
customer_reviews.author: S. Bailey

customer_reviews.title: LARGE AWESOME PHONE
customer_reviews.text: Awesome phone / too large for my hands. Ended up returning, but not because of size... had trouble connecting to person on other end of calls. Calls came through, I'd pick up and then __________ nothing. This was with T-Mobile in the NE. Not sure if others had this problem, but if a phone can't do what a phone needs to do, it has to go back. May have been a fluke, but I didn't get a replacement due to the size of the phone. Otherwise, if I thought of it as a mini tablet, it was AWESOME! Screen is large and crystal clear. Processed tasks quickly/no lagging. Everything else about this phone was super.
customer_reviews.author: J.Lia

customer_reviews.title: Lacks some polish but a decent phone for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Overall planning to keep for now but several things are aggravating enough that I am shopping around again. Pros: long battery life, decent camera, large clear display, very responsive for all apps tested thus far, storage capacity sufficient when couple with cloud storage practices. Cons: battery not easily replaced (well known prior to purchase), Bluetooth is incredibly finicky as compared with my other phones (iPhone6, Nexus, S3), volume & power button are strangely low centered such that holding it with hitting them if often difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Ross

customer_reviews.title: The front speakers are great for watching shows and movies
customer_reviews.text: The front speakers are great for watching shows and movies. It can play 1080p HEVC videos in hardware mode except for the 10-bit color depth ones (in which case they run in software mode and the phone is too slow to play at normal speed). The Gmail app works great; it works with non-Gmail e-mail accounts as well now. The cell phone reception (in terms of bars) seems a little better than that of my old Samsung Galaxy S4 when in buildings. Battery life between charges is good enough; I keep chargers at home, work, and in my cars.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Really good phone at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good phone especially for the price. Good display. Perfect screen size for me. Good brightness. Good volume and power button placement. Power button has different texture to distinguish it from volume buttons. Good sound quality. Camera is pretty good. Digital image proccesing does a good job of cleaning up pictures. Nice "grippy" texture on the back. Don't really like the headphone jack location on the top of the phone, but it's not to bad at least after getting used to it. Overall again just a really solid phone really don't think it can beat for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Camp

customer_reviews.title: Battery and overheating
customer_reviews.text: The rest of the phone is fine, but the facts that it loses charge and overheats so easily are big issues. You literally require a special kind of charger for it to not die even while plugged in. Also, due to the fact that it charges through micro-USB, it is hard to find charging cables that don't slip after use over time.
customer_reviews.author: David Chang

customer_reviews.title: Good good phone wish battery was good as ultra max
customer_reviews.text: Great Phone but bigger screen is a battery drain it only last 5 hours for me. I did order a 25w charger though. It takes 45 - 1hr to full charge with that charger. I have got used to plugging in when driving so that I don't drain all the way before end of day. I got a used phone and was sent a 2w generic charger with it. Also I use a aux cord for hands free and you have to hit speaker phone ever time you receive or make calls. It works fine for media and does not do it with head phones only aux cord. After reading reviews more I think my phone has a bad battery.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Excellent phone
customer_reviews.text: Excellent phone. I have had it for over a year. I think it's the best phone I have ever owned. Too bad Motorola has not made a new version of it. It has almost all the features I wanted in a phone. I have not had a single problem with it. It's fast, it has a great display. The camera is ok, not great.
customer_reviews.author: LG

customer_reviews.title: The screen is terrific, performance is snappy
customer_reviews.text: It's really hard to find any true flaws with the Moto X Pure Edition. The screen is terrific, performance is snappy, the camera performs well, and the front speakers are easily the best in the business. My only complaint is that the new Lenovo Motorola team is slower to get out software updates. Previous editions of the Moto X got the latest version of Android as soon as Nexus devices. Now it seems like they are going to take a few extra months to roll them out. Otherwise, it's a wonderful device. The size and weight are nice. It doesn't feel like a 5.7" device in the hand, but it does when you are watching videos.
customer_reviews.author: C. Perry

customer_reviews.title: There is a lot to like about this phone
customer_reviews.text: There is a lot to like about this phone. I'm sure you've read all the positives in the other reviews. I had no problem getting Verizon to port my old cell phone number over to it. I bought it because it of the nice feature set, including being a very large phone. Frankly, if I had to do it over again, I think I would have bought the Droid Maxx 2 or Droid Turbo 2 since this phone may actually be a little too large for me. The only other problem I have noticed is that some Apps like Yahoo Fantasy Sports don't work right, but I blame Yahoo for that.
customer_reviews.author: Topher

customer_reviews.title: Love this phone!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome phone! A little big, but then again I have small hands and I'm getting used to it. The phone is very fast, sleek, and responsive. I really like the whole "2 shakes and it opens to a camera" thing. I upgraded from an iPhone 4 to this, and it's much better. Probably because it's newer but you can also customize the phone a lot more. This phone plays Pokemon Go very well. I'm sure someone's looking for that tidbit.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie E.

customer_reviews.title: Short battery life. Don't bother.
customer_reviews.text: I have had the phone for 2 years with average use. The battery life is now 4.5 hours. This makes the phone useless. I can pay $125 for a new battery. While this is a cheap phone this is unacceptable. Motorola has lost a customer for life. Back to Samsung with me.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Great but too often overlooked phone!
customer_reviews.text: Coming from a Nexus 5 first gen I wanted a more pure Android experience than what Samsung offered. Although the Moto X has many unique features not present in the Nexus, Motorola has still left most of the layout and menu function from pure Android intact. I love using the infrared sensor to "wave" on my notifications when the screen goes to sleep and the turbo charger is great for quick charging without overheating the phone like my wife's Galaxy S7 does.
customer_reviews.author: Brian M

customer_reviews.title: Much better reception than my old G4
customer_reviews.text: Fast, marshmallow Android 6, no hesitation. Activated on ATT. Much better reception than my old G4. Bluetooth good. Camera good enough for me and fast. Video has no lag. Only complaint for me is that i often inadvertently make contact with the volume buttons on the right side of the phone and I am left handed. Wish they we in another place or more recessed. Please, net edition have fingerprint sensor. Oh yes, the qualcomm turbo charger is great and you can buy these for the car too so you never run out of juice during the day no moatter how much you use it.
customer_reviews.author: glandpuck

customer_reviews.title: Love this phone.
customer_reviews.text: I thought I was going to hate having a phablet sized phone, but have found that it is still small enough to handle. I love how good this phone is at staying connected. With my old phone I had to leave the building, with this one, I'm alway connected. Also, it feels like I have unlimited memory. I can finally cache my entire liked playlist YAY!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amber Worth

customer_reviews.title: ... for a little over a month and I have enjoyed the experience with it
customer_reviews.text: I have had this phone for a little over a month and I have enjoyed the experience with it. This is what these companies should be doing making flagship type phones with the a budget price. I had a HTC One M8 and paid almost double the amount for it and yet this phone has higher level specs with far more additional features with a stellar experience such as speed, expandable storage, quick updates and the Moto Assist features. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Zico Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Solid, cost effective, and colorful
customer_reviews.text: Takes excellent pictures. Makes clear calls. Screen easy to read while texting. Bamboo back goes with bamboo in my yard. Fits in a big pocket. And believe it is on sale now (11.20.16) for a hundred bucks less. The model is a couple years old now but if you're only using it for pics, txt, some searches, calling, or watching vids, it's a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Lou Zitnik

customer_reviews.title: Charging issues early on.
customer_reviews.text: It's quite a nice phone, but less than a year later the charging port is completely screwed up. Only a few months in and had to start manipulating the charger wire... now it just doesn't charge at all. For a few hundred bucks you expect more than 8 months!
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Very Solid Phone
customer_reviews.text: I completely destroyed my Nexus 5 and I didn't want a Nexus 6P because it is humongous. I didn't know what to do but after researching and learning that Motorola is as close to pure Android as you can get without buying a Nexus I was excited. This phone is awesome. It has a nice VERY SOLID feel to it. I like the rounded back. It is easier to hold than my old Nexus 5. It is simple the best smart phone I've ever had, or seen anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: F. Gomez

customer_reviews.title: I Like a lot of functions on this phone and it ...
customer_reviews.text: I Like a lot of functions on this phone and it was a great deal less than I would have paid for an iphone or galaxy. I particularly like the option of adding a micro sd card as either internal or removable storage. I also love the voice command features on this one, and google voice absolutely blows siri out of the water. It does have its quirks now and again but generally restarting the phone fixes them all. A great value overall.
customer_reviews.author: Reed

customer_reviews.title: Great, Simple SmartPhone- Received Wrong Color
customer_reviews.text: I already have this phone but needed more storage, ordered the phone in white but received the bamboo one, I think there is kind of mixed up, saw where someone ordered the bamboo but got white. I'm kinda bummed but ultimately I realize I'll have a phone cover it anyways. I think this smartphone is great if you're needing something simple but can still do alot! I have no issues with phone calls and think it takes very good pictures!
customer_reviews.author: Cat R.

customer_reviews.title: IMHO the best android phone out there
customer_reviews.text: IMHO the best android phone out there. The specs won't absolutely blow you away. But If you focus on user experience, this is the best Android phone hands down. The many useful features of Moto X such as Moto Display, Moto Actions, Moto Voice makes this the best user experience. The stereo speakers are great for media. The Always Listening feature of Moto Voice is extremely useful. Only complaint is that I can't get Moto Voice to work while in the car and connected to bluetooth.
customer_reviews.author: D. Lu

customer_reviews.title: Great phone
customer_reviews.text: Great phone. Does everything more expensive phones do but cheaper. Has some cool tricks like giving the phone two shakes to turn the flashlight on and off and rotating your hand back and forth to turn on the camera. Battery could be better and the camera, despite being 21 megs, could be sharper and better but overall it is a great phone and the size of the screen helps with my old eyes.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Richards

customer_reviews.title: One of the best phones with an amazing list price
customer_reviews.text: This phone is amazing for the price. One of the best phones out and only $400. If you can afford to prepay for your phone get this one and save on your monthly bill. I took two to cricket and only pay $70 for two at&t lines. There is no such thing as a free phone. Very comfortable to hold for a phone of its size. You won't get stuck with all the bloatwear the phone company's phones will stick you with and you don't have to wait for carrier to release update.
customer_reviews.author: Dan M.

customer_reviews.title: Hello Moto (but only from Amazon)
customer_reviews.text: This is a great middle end phone...I say middle end because it has a decent amount of bells and whistles without all the crap you'll never need. I wish it had a fingerprint scanner and a better update schedule. Motorola sucks at updates and has the worst customer service...why I bought from Amazon and not Motorola directly. Heaven forbid you ever need to RMA with Motorola. Fortunately, their phones are decent enough in quality - if there is an issue you'll probably have early and can return to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua A. Appelt

customer_reviews.title: Good camera feature, big screen.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a phone expert, but I upgraded from my 1st smart phone (a moto E). This has a huge screen (a pro and con) and kind of fits in my pocket, but not very well. The camera was the selling point for this phone for me. I have little kids and this camera is great for capturing their wiggly moments without too much blurriness.
customer_reviews.author: alishas

customer_reviews.title: It's not awful but could be better. I've had all Motorola like them better than ...
customer_reviews.text: Well I'm a moto fan. It is larger than I expected, but getting use to it. Still learning all it does. Photos are much nicer. Battery life is only reason it did not get 5 stars. It's not awful but could be better. I've had all Motorola like them better than anything out there. It was supper easy to get all my contacts ,Facebook, emails, apps moved over from Verizon. Would recommend this phone.
customer_reviews.author: De zborowski

customer_reviews.title: Thoroughly pleased
customer_reviews.text: This is the first phone I have owned that I haven't wanted to break and replace after 3 months. Its been thoroughly satisfying. I don't memory space issues. The battery is adequate and the turbo charges helps when it gets a lot of use. Sound and video are great for me too. The camera is supper. I did just drop the thing and have to switch out the digitizer/glass/lcd screen. Youtube and some patience made that a successful chore. Speaker accents were the worst part of that process.
customer_reviews.author: Kaptainkaveman

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best phone I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Simply the best phone I have ever owned. I have always had cheap phones i guess. This thing picks up signals so much better then my last phone. I could not get a signal at all in my workplace with my last phone. And now i have 4 bars of 4G. The voice activation is very awesome, unless there is a song playing in the background, then i guess it gets muddled out, understandably. I had no idea phones could be this fast. It is not my PC by any means, but web pages load very fast. So get this phone if you want a reliable signal. T-Mobile prepaid here
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... had really high hopes and all the reviews were pretty good, maybe I got a defective phone
customer_reviews.text: I had really high hopes and all the reviews were pretty good, maybe I got a defective phone, the screen has a mind of its own, I can usually only use the phone a few minutes at a time before I have to push the power button, and then "restart" what I was doing, I've tried everything I can think of, changing settings, I'm done and frustrated, will be returning, bummed.
customer_reviews.author: stay

customer_reviews.title: Top Notch
customer_reviews.text: The phone is just as large as an iPhone 6S Plus but is less bulky. I love that there is also the capability to expand your internal storage with a micro USB. The phone runs fast and seems to perform better without all of the junk software pre-loaded by most carriers. I'm not sure if the $349 for 32 GB version will last but this is by far the best phone I've ever used for around half the price of its competitors. I prefer this phone to my wife's iPhone 6S Plus and the old Samsung Galaxy S6 I used to have.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with my upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded to this phone after accidentally destroying my Asus Zenfone 2. I'm impressed with the quality of this phone. I had owned a first generation Moto G in the past and the build quality of this phone is far superior. The operating software is nearly vanilla, as Motorola has only added a few minor tweaks. It's operates quickly and smoothly, all of my apps open and function without issue. It also had no issue recognizing and using my 64gb Micro SD card. I would recommend this phone over the Zenfone 2.
customer_reviews.author: Jesica

customer_reviews.title: I totally love it
customer_reviews.text: I love this phone. I've had it for two years now and it's been working super good so far. I lost the original charger like a year ago and the battery is just now starting to fail a little, but it still works great. It has the best camera I've ever had, I can take awesome pictures. I bought the one with 64 GB and that's what I recommend if you are the kind of person who downloads a bunch of apps and take a lot of pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Candela

customer_reviews.title: Great any-carrier handset
customer_reviews.text: This handset is a great companion for phone, text, and applications. It is very close to stock Android by Google and doesn't have a bunch of proprietary programs that get in your way and take up space. We use it with Verizon, but this unit can be taken to any major carrier at any time. This makes it great to keep your options open if you want to switch for better rates or a new promotion.
customer_reviews.author: dirtvoyles

customer_reviews.title: Great phone, not loving the camera.
customer_reviews.text: Like it a lot. Disappointed in the color and definition on the camera. The camera part is more important to me than the phone itself. Smile. The Moto G actually takes better pics. I was surprised and disappointed. Thought the Pure was supposed to be far superior. I've taken pics with both, at the same time, and the Moto G has much more true color and clarity. Disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Step Lively

customer_reviews.title: Awesome top of the line phone for a budget price!
customer_reviews.text: I loved my 6.4 inch Sony Experia Z ultra phablet with 6.4 inch screen. The fact that the phone was two years old showed when Google was not longer updating the phone(i had the Google Play edition). I decided I'd get new phone with faster specs and stock Android that's expandable with microSD and water resistant and that had tmobile band 12. Amazon had a sale for this phone and I grabbed it. I had no regrets! In fact, I love this phone! I had it for two months and I found it superior to my Sony phone.
customer_reviews.author: psat

customer_reviews.title: Nearly perfect with a few minor gripes.
customer_reviews.text: A top notch device that isn't burdened by carrier or OEM bloatware. The only knock on it is that Motorola seems to be dragging their feet on updates. Android 6.0.1 has been around for 6 months and it nowhere to be found on this flagship. The Motorola camera app is also a little shaky and new versions of Google's camera are incompatible. Minor gripes all around, though. Motorola and the Nexus lines are the only way to go.
customer_reviews.author: C. A.

customer_reviews.title: Very well made phone.
customer_reviews.text: This phone is fast, I switched over from a Oneplus One and the speed of this blew me away. The display is leaps and bounds better than most phones out there, very crisp and clear. It has a MicroSD slot which is rare now and days. The only down side is the battery is not removalable but the charger that is supplied makes up for that, it will charge the phone in less than a hour. 10 mins on the charger and you're close to 50% then it switches to a slow charge to keep from overheating the battery. Very recommend phone.
customer_reviews.author: Carolina_Z32

customer_reviews.title: Good phone!
customer_reviews.text: Was as close to pure Android as you could get at the time. Other than a Nexus.
customer_reviews.author: matty032

customer_reviews.title: Great phone so far
customer_reviews.text: Great phone so far, upgrading from a first generation moto x (which I still love). Camera is great, hands free is my favorite. It's bigger than my old phone but it wasn't a deal breaker. Will update further once I'm out of the honeymoon phase with the phone. Oh, and It was super easy to connect to the Verizon network too
customer_reviews.author: jlt

customer_reviews.title: Amazing in every aspect
customer_reviews.text: Amazing in every aspect. Just one flaw: earphone jack works really bad. It cuts the music every now and then and, doing a little bit of research, it is a tipical problem of this phone. Get bluetooth earphones or it will be a pain in the...
customer_reviews.author: Juan Diego

customer_reviews.title: Great phone terrible Camera App
customer_reviews.text: The phone itself is wonderful packed with loads of great features for such a low price however the camera app is so basic that it's just terrible, even with the camera's wonderful specs the app is just annoying. However for people who love to point and shoot with no additional features it's not a problem. (incase you're wondering the reason people don't use other camera apps on the market is simply because they can't be launched by the moto double twist action)
customer_reviews.author: Devon S.

customer_reviews.title: Don't spend any more, this is the one
customer_reviews.text: I've been using cell phones since 1993, have gone through many of them. This is the best yet. You absolutely do not need to spend more than this on a phone, if you do, you're wasting your money and buying for status only. I laugh at the $700.00 HTC 10, you'd have to be out of your mind to spend that much on a phone that does nothing more than the Moto X Pure Edition.
customer_reviews.author: Pard

customer_reviews.title: Excellent item for an excellent price!
customer_reviews.text: This phone rocks! I get compliments all the time on the bamboo back. Very smooth running. There has been some getting used to the SD storage on this phone due to some applications not recognizing the "Single Storage" SD card formatting. Based on the cost of this phone it's a no brainer in purchasing an off contract phone. I can't imagine what functionality I would need to spend $600+ on that I don't have on this phone.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Contreras

customer_reviews.title: I love this device
customer_reviews.text: I love this device. It works well has a nice camera and plenty of features to keep me happy. Activating on Verizon was a little bit of an issue but from reading online message boards I knew to go to a Verizon corporate store and not an authorized retailer. The best part is it has none of the bloatware that Verizon phones a full of. They screen is not as good as a Samsung but is more than acceptable. I selected the 16 GB version because it take SD cards up to 128 GB. I put in a 64 GB card and have more storage than I'll ever need.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Bogle

customer_reviews.title: Don't wait buy now
customer_reviews.text: I would highly recommend! I had a Blu 5.5 for 2 years and upgraded to this Motorola and I am very satisfied. The screen is responsive and there is no lag in data loading. I don't know why I waited so long!!! Don't doubt this phone it is worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: C Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: and it's been Great! Love the motion features to launch flash light ...
customer_reviews.text: Been using this phone for about three weeks now, and it's been Great! Love the motion features to launch flash light and the camera. The bamboo back definitely makes this phone stands out from those metal and plastic covers. Although I have to get a cover to protect it from scratch (trust me you won't want to see a scratch on such a nice bamboo cover) you can still the beautiful bamboo back from the clear case I put on. If you like a pure Android experience and premium design, this is the phone to go with!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cant get anyone to replace the battery
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this phone in April of 2017. I loved this phone. It took great pictures and I was quite happy with it until present day September 2019. The battery has lasted a little over 2 years and nobody wants to replace it because it is just too difficult. Had I known that, I probably would not have purchased it. It was a great phone, but the inability to replace the battery in a cost effective manner is a deal breaker for me. Sorry Motorola, I will not order another one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... phone from more than one year and still working like New, inside and outside
customer_reviews.text: I got this cell phone from more than one year and still working like New, inside and outside !! what I like more from this cell phone is the commands when I'm driving I can easily answer a call or message without touch the phone.
customer_reviews.author: Alfredo

customer_reviews.title: Upgraded from Nexus 6- better camera, fits in hand/pocket better, SD slot FTW!
customer_reviews.text: Came from a Nexus 6 that had flash memory issues. Warrantied that and sold the replacement. Bought this as a amazon warehouse deal. Great phone. Good battery life so far. Snappy processor and no lag. Camera works good and front facing is the best I have seen so far. Build quality is solid and no issues with cheap plastic. Came with a ribbed rubber back and a motorola bump in the middle. It helps when holding the phone with one hand to locate the center with the index finger. Comes with SD slot which was my main goal in changing from the nexus 6. Will probably buy one for the wife soon as well.
customer_reviews.author: Justin C Nall

customer_reviews.title: More power to Motorola
customer_reviews.text: I have the original Moto X (2013 ). It still is a great phone. I wanted a bigger screen . Pure edition fits my wish. Moto's unique software is the major reason to come back to Motorola. Pure edition is a major upgrade for me. Delighted to have Micro SD. Camera is a major improvement over the 2013 version. Beautiful screen. Nice stereo speakers. Quick Charger. Battery is good and will last all day depending on your usage. Price is icing to the cake. Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: JOC

customer_reviews.title: Motorola has been making some great phones lately and this one is not exception
customer_reviews.text: Motorola has been making some great phones lately and this one is not exception. I love their light tough on Android. The essentially leave Android alone and only add a few features, that Android should have left as part of their system. The improved voice commands are something Google could learn from. Overall this is a great phone and I will continue to watch what Motorola is doing in the future.
customer_reviews.author: RR

customer_reviews.title: I love the Moto X - it was my favorite phone ...
customer_reviews.text: I love the Moto X - it was my favorite phone in the world. It suddenly for no reason started blinking out and dying. I've owned it for 6 months. I'm getting it warranty replaced, but it was sad. This phone is NOT like the one motorola themselves sells, as it also has amazon ads. If you want an ad-free phone, direct purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Heatherthediva

customer_reviews.title: The improvements over the last Moto X are fantastic and plenty
customer_reviews.text: I've had two different Moto Gs and 3 different Moto Xs and this will definitely be my last Moto device. The improvements over the last Moto X are fantastic and plenty, but the Bluetooth handling is a joke, the screen keeps going off and on during videos and don't look now but SAMSUNG is going to beat Moto on updates, pushing their heavily skinned Nougat next week, beating Motorola to the punch for the Moto X Pure.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Richards

customer_reviews.title: Great size, memory
customer_reviews.text: Advantages: Great size, memory, specifications, works in the Caribbean Disadvantages: I am not having a good experience as I thought that I would have. The phone is a bit glitchy in terms of the touch screen. The bottom area by the back arrow, return menu ( center) and windows active ( square) stopped working, so I needed to have auto totate on, turn the screen for it to work. Also at times, I would be listening to messages and the volume would decrease and sometimes when you are in an app, the phone goes blank
customer_reviews.author: tessa

customer_reviews.title: Motorola have really released a poorly designed piece of crap!!
customer_reviews.text: Worked extremely well for a year then the battery started to drain quickly. Finally the battery just died and I had to send it to the repair shop. They tried a new battery but that did not work either because according to them the motherboard is fried. $350 down the drain!! This item over heats and it's battery dies. I am guessing when the phone dies for other users as well, because this phone was barely released a year ago it's overall rating will go down. Motorola have really released a poorly designed piece of crap!!!
customer_reviews.author: Shariq

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I received a defective product; phone ran very hot performing simple tasks like browsing and took extremely long to charge even with included turbo charger (charge time estimate given ranged from 2 to 7 hours and ran very hot while charging, which is very bad for batteries). I'd be wary as I've been reading quite a few reviews from users that have received defective units here and in Android forums. Although if you have to return the device (which I had to do) the process is hassle free, and if you really want to get this phone you could go ahead and test it out and if you encounter any problems request a replacement and hope it's okay...
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great phone for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great phone for the price. I can't understand why someone would pay an extra $300 for a premium smart phone when this one does everything you need. The only negatives I can list are that the battery gets a little hot sometimes, and the battery life could be better. The phone came with a turbo charger that works great. Gives a full charge, from 0% in less than two hours.
customer_reviews.author: thomas jordan

customer_reviews.title: this is a great upgrade. The phone is a lot bigger than ...
customer_reviews.text: Coming from Moto X 1st Gen, this is a great upgrade. The phone is a lot bigger than my 1st Gen. All specs better, better battery life too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Cell Phone at Affordable Price !
customer_reviews.text: I have had this phone for about 18 months. It is a very nice cell phone for a very affordable price. The only criticism would be that the battery drains fairly quickly. Thanfully it comes with a turbo charger to speed things up. It is a very smooth device and it operates flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: A Lubbock Guy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent phone for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Have had the phone for about a month now. I upgraded from 1st gen moto x, which I liked very much. This phone is everything I expected it to be. It is much bigger than the first gen, almost to big. But I did get used to the size after a few days. Front speakers are a huge improvement. Battery life is average, but the turbo charger works very well. Some have complained about the phone running hot. My has not exhibited this issue at all. I prefer the almost stock android without all the bloatware. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: dglb39

customer_reviews.title: Great phone all around
customer_reviews.text: Pros: very clean android experience, fast android updates, great screen, great camera, great implementation of quick gestures, super fast charging Cons: no fingerprint reader, battery life could be better, can get hot while gaming This is a great all-around phone, and in my opinion the best phone that can be purchased under $400. I honestly even consider it better than some of the more expensive phones out. Try to catch this phone on sale for under $300 and it's probably the best bang for your buck right now.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Best Android experience on the market. I also owned the Moto X 1st Gen and this thing blows that out of the water in every way. Be prepared: this is a large phone and not for those who are looking for something smaller for their front pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Glad I switch to Moto (from HTC)
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised to discover that this model met my needs perfectly. Lots of built-in memory, plus I can expand with SD card! The concern was that the size is a bit larger than my previous phone... difficult to put in my front pants pocket. But the features of Moto app beat the HTC app phone enhancement. The phone is well built and takes great pictures. I'm glad I made the switch.
customer_reviews.author: PT Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: I am happy with screen size and performance and got a decent ...
customer_reviews.text: Only thing this phones needs it to be thinner. I am happy with screen size and performance and got a decent deal on Amazon. I came from an iPhone 6s 128gb and just got tired paying. $900 for a phone. I have it running on Metro PCS $60 unlimited plan and also have a $35 a month Total Wireless 5GB LTE (Verizon) sim for it. Works great with Metro . Verizon is on but no Voice over LTE or date while talking. It can get hot at times also. Battery life could be better but fast charging makes up for that.
customer_reviews.author: Matt MacGregor

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Great phone. It's a slow OS compared to the new phones but I love the style and size. This is my second buy of this phone.
customer_reviews.author: Tim McVicker

customer_reviews.title: Great unlocked phone.  Can't beat this deal.
customer_reviews.text: Great phone all around. I shopped relentlessly for the best deal on an unlocked phone for straight talk service. I couldn't be happier with the price and functionality of this phone.
customer_reviews.author: Matt D.

customer_reviews.title: Everything I want in a phone
customer_reviews.text: Phenomenal phone for the price. Motorola took all the good things phones can implement and eliminated all of the bloat and useless features. Honestly everything just works, which is so nice to have. The screen is beautiful and the battery life is great. The speakers are nice and loud and the call quality is solid. Just checks all the boxes.
customer_reviews.author: Dominic

customer_reviews.title: Most Excellent Customer service!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. 21 MP Camera! Wow. Excellent Customer service! had to get screen replaced. Shipped out and returned in less than 72 hours! Wow! ...overnight to TX; one day repair, (actually just gave me a new phone...!), one day return by evening meal time... Currently using 7 Motos in the household... we like the MotoG4 also...
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Great phone. Quick
customer_reviews.text: Great phone. Quick, has no issues with lag or multitasking, and does exactly what I need it to. However, the battery as of late has gotten bad and I cannot go a full day without needing to charge it. The screen also developed slight blue warping, but its only noticeable when the screen is on and the screen is black and apparently its a frequent problem with this phone.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.text: Despite the big announcement in April 2017, it would appear this phone is NOT getting the Nougat Android update at least not anytime soon and that was a big deal to me and why I bought it. Shame because other than a slightly disappointing battery life ( another big reason I bought it) I am really starting to love this phone.
customer_reviews.author: rifleman1

customer_reviews.title: Great phone. Real money saver. Don't waste $300 a year on crap smartphones. Buy this instead!
customer_reviews.text: Had this for over a year. Still works great! Love the android updates. Battery not so great but turbo charger works fast and makes up for it. Camera is awesome! Just wish it came with a built in music player. I've never had a smartphone last even close to a year and this one has at least another year of life left in it (and I use it for everything). Real money saver! And better specs than Samsung Galaxy S and Note series.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn

customer_reviews.title: So far so good, box was damaged upon arrival but the device ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, box was damaged upon arrival but the device is flawless and beautiful at first sight. Feels much better and faster than an iPhone in hand for sure. And is less than half of the price tag.
customer_reviews.author: Jesus

customer_reviews.title: The phone kicks ...you know.
customer_reviews.text: My favorite phone! I'm a bit of a phone nut (currently have 5). If I could only keep one, this would be it (Nexus 6 would be close 2nd). It gets fantastic reception, has no bloatware so it's snappy fast, incredible speakers, etc. I would highly recommend this phone to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: T. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: A great phone that works on all major carriers!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this phone for a relative and love the fact that it works on all major carriers! Has very good battery life and a large bright screen, the only draw back would be the support for updates by motorola.
customer_reviews.author: Artie Wentworth

customer_reviews.title: Horrible phone. Would not keep signal
customer_reviews.text: Horrible phone. Would not keep signal. Tried for weeks.. New Sim card, nearest, reprogrammed.. Everything.. Just not a very good radio.
